channel.title: davewiner tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from davewiner.

item.description:
My guess is that every billionaire is going to try to compete with Musk, maybe some will join together. If you know how to write a TWTR get busy.
AWS should have, long ago, written a faceless TWTR clone, and let a million flowers bloom. As with many other things, I beat the drum ceaselessly for this, as far as I know they never heard me.
That's why it was interesting to see @jeffbezos poke @elonmusk in the eye this morning. That's exactly the kind of thing a competitor would say, and the fact that he said it so publicly, on TWTR, says he's going to do it. He wants to reserve the space in our minds.
Anyway another thought, making a federated twitter will be hard. No one knows how to do it. But I bet a lot of people know how to clone twitter. That's the way this will go.
And we should make sure all these clones can peer with each other.
I'm available to help with this.
BTW, here's the Bezos tweet.
https://t.co/CRdB3Eqny8
@FlipperPA @_tagine Has anyone written anything about this?
In January 2017, as Trump was taking office, I warned that a Republican could buy Twitter. Here's a short thread, explaining. https://t.co/d1z4p9KBCe

In January 2017, as Trump was taking office, I warned that a Republican could buy Twitter. That it had enormous value that wasn't reflected on its balance sheet. It was only worth $12 billion then.
I contacted an investment banker, a friend I've known for 30+ years, a really creative guy, and I think he thought I was bonkers (he didn't say it as such).
Then I wrote a blog post to get it on the record.
https://t.co/P7QKFCq1Qa
PS: It's kind of embarrassing I said that Zuck would run for president, that was before his rep blew up.
Jeff Jarvis: "The rates and terms for Musk's loans have to be terrible." https://t.co/4uWTGYsET3
I hope they don't sell GitHub to Elon Musk. ;-) https://t.co/yF6epqd4Fc
Most Americans Have Been Infected With Coronavirus at Least Once, C.D.C. Says. https://t.co/eNe4epMEvZ
Kamala Harris tests positive for Covid. https://t.co/fKk6M8SXru
Meta is opening its first retail store next month. https://t.co/j1tniZOimU
@StevePopper I don't understand this: "extension that the Nets have to give since they'd be capped out anyway"
@TaylorLorenz they spelled your name correctly
@scottknaster I had a similar vision, of Musk at his Fortress of Solitude.

@Jason For such a young guy he has a very fear-driven way of looking at things. As if he or anyone has any idea where we're going. Remember we used to talk about jumping out of a plane with no parachute and building the parachute on the way down. That's basically my comfort level. ;-)

@phonetonote very nice. i think i get it -- they're going through your follows on twitter, then going to their websites, looking for <link>s to feeds and then adding them to the OPML file that it outputs.

@rswilbourn @elonmusk I agree. To understand you really have to have some experience in tech. I'm hoping that 90% of what he does is simply straighten things out so they can start adding features, and supporting new interfaces. Twitter should be at the center of something amazing.
It's not fair the way Knicks fans are dissing Nets fans, but I guess it's ok because as we all know there aren't any Nets fans.
@kellabyte @clemensv the power is amazing.
@Knickstape2005 First you have to show up with a team before we can start talking about a rivalry.
Right. These days "conservative" == "stupid". https://t.co/9iEU5C1ffD

I *love* this NYT headline. Basically, you grow teams, there's no such thing as a superteam. When you try to conjure up one as the Nets keep doing you end up with suckage as was on display this season at Barclay's. https://t.co/ntkheK8syt
I have enjoyed this year's Knicks, with all those sweet rookies and sophomores, and have thoroughly enjoyed trashing the pathetic "superteam" that plays in Brooklyn. This is and always will be the Knicks' city.
https://t.co/tWnj4LHC8t
@ashevat I hope this all works out for all of us. Twitter is a very important service.

@KnicksMemes At that moment knicks fans all said to themselves ‘he’s dead to me” and poor KD never bothered to learn that 99% of NBA fans in NYC love the Knicks, and the other 1% root for teams other than the Nets. There are a handful of holdovers mostly from NJ who say “KD whodat?”
@HardKnicksLife There aren’t any Nets fans.
I love how they talk about “Nets fans” — maybe there are a few in NJ or Bumfuck Egypt.
